newsitem.title: USA: Public Service Electric proposes pilot project.
newsitem.headline: Public Service Electric proposes pilot project.

text.p: Public Service Electric and Gas Co said on Friday it had proposed a pilot program to allow residential natural gas customers to buy the fuel from suppliers other than itself.
The company said it had selected four municipalities with a total of about 62,000 residents to participate in the program, namely Bloomfield, Piscataway, Pennsauken and Westampton.
It said the SelectGas Program would let customers buy gas directly from producers and marketers and arrange for Public Service Electric and Gas to transport and deliver the fuel.
The program would last until June 1, 1998, it added.
The company said commercial and industrial customers have had the option since December 1994 with more than 8,000 having signed up to participate.
